title: Dynamic Memory Allocation
subject: C Programming
theory:
Allocating memory at RUNTIME (not Compile time). 
- **Static**: Stack/Data segment. Fixed size.
- **Dynamic**: Heap. Flexible size. Manual control.

common_mistakes.correction: Forgetting to free() heap memory. It stays occupied until program ends.

real_world_use_cases.description: User enters size N. Cannot do `int arr[N]` in old C. Need `malloc`.
